ygData.subject: Re: Woven Or Netted Armor For A Wizard?
ygData.msgSnippet: Im wandering myself i just turn 15th and i have currently been hunting in befallen searching for the fabaled (sp) Damask armor i heard only a few pieces could
ygData.messageBody:
Im wandering myself i just turn 15th and i have currently been hunting
in befallen searching for the fabaled (sp) Damask armor i heard only a
few pieces could be found there but haven't scene any thus far..
However i also hurt a type of white robe is here also.. but im afraid
ill have to catch a partyu of more expirence before i venture further..
some other places i heard to search, forgive my spelling, Is lower in
some dungeon beginning with a n.. Najela or something of that nature.
But alas all my journeys has turned up is one damask wristband which i
found to be very familair to that of Legionarrie bracers. AC 3 in all.
but no magical prorties this only leads me to belive that armro for a
wizard does not get strong enough entill a Enchanter helps out a little
i guess.. Which also makes him a excellent person two pair with a
wizard.. but Hope this helps at the least most somewhat useful to ya..
I'll try to add more later.
Elmara- povar
--- jrc76@... wrote:
> From: jrc76@...
>
> I am currently a level 10 High Elf Wizard, and I
> have a Sr. Apprentice robe along with a full set of
> cloth armor. I would like to get either a full set
> of the woven or the netted armor next, as an upgrade
> from the cloth that I have now. I would like to know
> which of the two types would be best to get next.
> Also, what are the stats compared to the cloth
> armor? Any help would be appreciated!
> Regards,
> Kelill
>
>
